answers.text: God is the universe and the universe is God
God contains, but is not identical to, the Universe

qas.question: Who is the founder of Hasidic Judaism?
Who was the founder of Hasidic Judaism?

answers.text: God contains, but is not identical to, the Universe

qas.question: What from of Hinduism does not believe in panentheism?
What is another name for Jewish mysticism?
In Panentheism what is God identical to?
What does Baal Shem Tov believe if God is the universe?
Who is the founder of the Liberal Catholic Church?
What group does Vaishnavism have acceptance in as part of Jewish mysticism?
What is another name for Vaishnavism?

context: Pantheism holds that <a0_0><a8_0>God is the universe<a8_0/> and <b10_0>the universe is God<b10_0/><a0_0/>, whereas Panentheism holds that <a1_0><a5_0>God contains, but is not identical to, <b9_0>the Universe<a5_0/><a1_0/>.<b9_0/> It is also the view of the Liberal Catholic Church; Theosophy; some views of Hinduism except <a6_0>Vaishnavism<a6_0/>, which believes in panentheism; Sikhism; some divisions of Neopaganism and Taoism, along with many varying denominations and individuals within denominations. <a7_0>Kabbalah<a7_0/>, <a2_0><b13_0>Jewish mysticism<b13_0/><a2_0/>, paints a pantheistic/panentheistic view of God—which has wide acceptance in <b12_0>Hasidic Judaism<b12_0/>, particularly from their founder <a3_0><a4_0><b11_0>The Baal Shem Tov<b11_0/><a4_0/><a3_0/>—but only as an addition to the Jewish view of a personal god, not in the original pantheistic sense that denies or limits persona to God.[citation needed]
